question.title: Need help compiling a JavaFx project
question.body:
Created a JavaFX app using Java 21 and copied this tutorial to build my project

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=udigo_qSp_k

I then created my project, and everything ran fine in an IDE. When trying to upload to GitHub, I wanted to create a release, and followed this tutorial to compile

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kQaE2HlFeWY

Double-clicking the jar does nothing. Java -jar jar.jar comes out with this error

Error: JavaFX runtime components are missing, and are required to run this application

I have tried searching the internet, as well as other YouTube tutorials and ChatGPT, but nothing has helped me. In fact, I think ChatGPT corrupted a file path, but that's a separate issue.

Tried the same method from: How do i fix Error: JavaFX runtime components are missing, and are required to run this application
still hasn't worked

Using the default sample from IntelliJ also does not work; here is module-info.java and pom.xml

module org.fastsearch {
    requires javafx.controls;
    requires javafx.fxml;
    requires java.desktop;
    requires com.google.gson;


    opens org.fastsearch to javafx.fxml;
    exports org.fastsearch;
}

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0
         http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>com.fastsearch</groupId>
    <artifactId>fast-search</artifactId>
    <version>2.0.0</version>
    <packaging>jar</packaging>

    <name>Fast Search</name>
    <description>Fast File and Content Search Tool with JavaFX UI</description>

    <properties>
        <maven.compiler.source>21</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>21</maven.compiler.target>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <javafx.version>22</javafx.version>
        <gson.version>2.10.1</gson.version>
    </properties>

    <dependencies>
        <!-- JavaFX -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-controls</artifactId>
            <version>${javafx.version}</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-fxml</artifactId>
            <version>${javafx.version}</version>
        </dependency>

        <!-- Gson for JSON config -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.google.code.gson</groupId>
            <artifactId>gson</artifactId>
            <version>${gson.version}</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <!-- Maven Compiler Plugin -->
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.11.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>21</source>
                    <target>21</target>
                    <release>21</release>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>

            <!-- JavaFX Maven Plugin -->
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
                <artifactId>javafx-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>0.0.8</version>
                <configuration>
                    <mainClass>org.fastsearch.FastSearchApp</mainClass>
                    <executable>${java.home}/bin/java</executable>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>

            <!-- Maven Shade Plugin for creating fat JAR -->
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-shade-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.5.0</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <phase>package</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>shade</goal>
                        </goals>
                        <configuration>
                            <transformers>
                                <transformer implementation="org.apache.maven.plugins.shade.resource.ManifestResourceTransformer">
                                    <mainClass>com.fastsearch.FastSearchApp</mainClass>
                                </transformer>
                            </transformers>
                            <filters>
                                <filter>
                                    <artifact>*:*</artifact>
                                    <excludes>
                                        <exclude>META-INF/*.SF</exclude>
                                        <exclude>META-INF/*.DSA</exclude>
                                        <exclude>META-INF/*.RSA</exclude>
                                    </excludes>
                                </filter>
                            </filters>
                        </configuration>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
</project>

If needed my specific repo is here https://github.com/trashdino0/FastSearch

Manifest.mf

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Main-Class: org.fastsearch.FastSearchApp

here is a link to the jar https://gofile.io/d/UHDBvy

question_comments.body: @jewelsea apologies manage to figure it out

You can ask a new question specifically about your Gson issue, I suggest doing that.  There are also other Json serialization technologies, like Jackson you could try instead of Gson, though Gson should work OK I would think (I am not recommending one over the other).

@Slaw Thanks so much for the help. This seems to have fixed the problem. Now, after compilation and running, I get this error, which seems to be unrelated to the previous issue but related to Gson. I don't necessarily need Gson, but it makes my code and future updates easier. From searching on Stack Overflow, it seems to be because I cannot have multiple modules, but I'm not entirely sure how I could fix or change this. I'd prefer to keep Gson.

That second point is the solution pointed out in the Q&A you linked. But you say that didn't work. Did you update the <mainClass> elements in your POM file? Both elements, but particularly in the configuration of maven-shade-plugin?

You seem to be creating a shaded ("fat", "uber") executable JAR file. Two things regarding that. (1) If that's your only deployment strategy then making your code modular is not helpful. You should also probably add module-info.class to your exclusions. (2) JavaFX technically only supports being loaded as named modules. If the main class is a subclass of javafx.application.Application and the javafx.graphics module is not present then you'll see the "runtime components are missing" error. The workaround is to create a separate main class that simply launches the JavaFX application.
Your manifest is missing a Class-Path.
